column4: hi- i unnstalled something, and my ubuntu has been.. quirky.. ever since.  Ubuntu is now not detecting external usb storage media.  It detects my USB wireless nic fine, but neither my HD or my mp3 player.
no, the ports on the Motherboard
there is some hal addon storage process that takes care of mounting usb drives, but forgot what its called exactly
does the device show via lsusb
there is a Bus 002 Device 002: "microsoft..."  <-- this may very well be my external HD
in dmesg it will tell you what drives are assigned
ty, i will dig through the dmesg info
if you unplug and replug the device the last few dmesg lines will hold what you are looking for
you probably killed off the automounter somehow or the system cant mount the fs on the mp3 player?
it could read the fs on the mp3 player before.  I am quite confident its something in the automounter chain that's fubared... is there anything i can do about it?
gnome-volume & gnome-volume-manager, reinstall and reconfigure those?
